function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Comparing both models, the only two variables in common are the number of inhabitants under 12 and the relative contribution to the household income.","Impact":"Potential bias in the comparison of green space perception models between Portugal and other countries.","Mitigation":"Conduct a more detailed analysis of the cultural and social factors influencing green space perception in each country, accounting for unique variables and perspectives.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and qualitative research methods for cross-cultural analysis.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, and urban planners involved in understanding and enhancing green space perception.","Owner":"Research institutions and government agencies."},{"Description":"It is interesting to notice how the WTP for a large green roof in Portugal builds up on the WTP for a smaller one and the availability to pay more for a larger one.","Impact":"Potential influence of affordability and willingness to pay on the perception of green roof benefits.","Mitigation":"Conduct additional studies to assess the impact of economic factors on the perceived value of green roofs, and consider non-monetary aspects of green space benefits.","Technologies":"Economic modeling, behavioral economics research, and cost-benefit analysis.","People":"Economic researchers, urban developers, and environmental policymakers.","Owner":"Academic institutions, economic research organizations, and city planning departments."},{"Description":"Educational level, household inhabitants, and other socio-economic factors found to be statistically significant in the model for the WTP for a larger green roof in other countries.","Impact":"Risk of socio-economic disparities influencing the adoption and perception of green roofs.","Mitigation":"Implement policies and programs to ensure equitable access to green roofs, and consider the socio-economic context when planning and promoting green roof initiatives.","Technologies":"Social impact assessment, community engagement strategies, and urban development frameworks.","People":"Community organizations, urban development agencies, and policymakers focused on social equity.","Owner":"Municipalities, non-profit organizations, and government bodies working on urban development."}]}
